reviewText: Behind Yummy, Yummy DVD, my boys enjoy Wiggle Time. The songs are still pretty simple and the hand motions are easy for my 15 month olds to pick up. I have a few DVD's of the newer Wiggles, but my boys still prefer the original cast and low budget backdrops in this DVD and in the Yummy, Yummy DVD. Maybe as the boys grow up, they'll appreciate the new cast members and the more complicated songs and locations of the updated Wiggles, but for now- this DVD is perfect for their level of comprehension and play. Their favorite songs are: Here comes a Bear, Uncle Noah's Ark, Rock-a-Bye Your Bear and Marching Along...
summary: My boys second favorite Wiggles DVD

reviewText: It's time to wiggle and giggle with 4 sweet colorful guys-the Wiggles.  I have always loved Greg the Yellow Wiggle even though I also love Murray, Anthony and Jeff.Wiggle Time is a music video type of movie with songs that include, "Here Comes A Bear", "Captain Feathersword", "I Love It When It Rains" and "Get Ready To Wiggle".My love for the Wiggles grows strong, every day.
Title: N/A

reviewText: You can't go wrong with any of the Wiggles Videos.  My daugthers 2.5 and 1 year old absolutely love them.  They dance and sing along to the video and have a great time.  The kids and I really enjoy the Wiggles You can tell that Jeff (Purple Wiggle), Anthony (Blue Wiggle), Greg (Yellow Wiggle) and Murray (Red Wiggle)are really loving what they are doing - entertaining children and having a great time.We also have the cd of this video to play in the car - the kids now don't mind going on car trips and even try and do some of the clapping and hand movements they remember from the video.Highly recommended.PS.  If you ever get a chance to see them live in concert - definately make the effort to go - they are great!

reviewText: The Wiggles: Wiggle Time is a great children's video with lots of catchy tunes and colorful scenes!  My 17 month old loves it!  He claps and bounces to the music!  The tunes are very entertaining and the Wiggles are a group of very energetic guys with loads of enthusiasm for what they do!  It's very infectious and I can see why they are very popular with the kids!  This is my first Wiggles DVD and so far so good!Some of the catchier tunes are Dorothy the Dinosaur and the Quack Quack Song and many more!  I think the Wiggles have the right formula for wholesome entertainment..especially for younger kids!I'm quite pleased!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is among the best of the collectibles of "The Wiggles" videos, and what makes it so is the supreme simplicity of this foursome, among whom are three pre-school teachers.  The songs, and the sounds, and the primary colors, and the characters are the best.  And one of the most interesting features of this video is the ending segment, where you see The Wiggles on stage at a "live event."  They are just as energetic, if not more so on stage, and it's a "Wiggles happening!!!"Highly recommended!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of the best offerings from the lovable Wiggles, this one contains all their best-loved songs.  Their energy is contagious, and the irritation factor is very low; our home is a strict Barney-Free Zone, but even my husband has come to love the Wiggles.  They're child-friendly without being saccharine, wholesome without being didactic, and do you know, the songs are pretty darn good.  Extra special benefit for parents of toddlers:  After your child dances along with this video, he'll be worn out and ready for a good long nap.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Out entire household is addicted to the Wiggles!  Our...daughter...is normally a comfy couch potato who likes to lounge on her bottom with her blankie and thumb to the likes of Elmo, Teletubbies, etc.  The Wiggles are a different story--this is truly interactive TV!She adores their music (kids always seem to love anything that's a little bit rock n' roll!), but it's not enough to just sit there and watch it--she MAKES us get up and dance!  If you're not standing, she's in front of you, tugging on your clothes until you join in.  Other kids shows say "Hey kids, let's get up and move!" with very little effect on my daughter (who enjoys watching them, but isn't moved to stand up and imitate them most of the time).  I can't really describe what it is about these four guys and their silly songs that makes it so addictive, but as my husband said, it's hard to say no to them!  Subliminal messages?  Maybe!I HIGHLY recommend the Wiggles in this video (or any of the others) to parents like me who may want to get into shape, but don't have time for the gym or money for a lot of exercise equipment.  What we have here is almost an aerobics class, which everyone can enjoy.  Forget "Sweatin' to the Oldies"!  Try some of the simple Wiggle movements!  The jumps, hand claps, "hot potato" movement, etc. may look simple, but try doing what Murray, Greg, Jeff, and Anthony do for ONE minute and you'll see--it really takes your breath away!  I became convinced after imitating them for a few minutes that these guys are in terrific shape.  I also became determined that if they can do it, I can do it--so our family (well, at least my oldest daughter and I) works out with the Wiggles two or three times a day! P>Warning:  If you're addicted to the Wiggles--a true Wigglemaniac, you may start wondering why EVERYONE isn't wearing a Wiggles Star-Trek-esque outfit and going around with "Fruit Salad, Yummy, Yummy" in their heads.
summary: Wiggly Workout Tape--For Kids and Adults!
Title: N/A

reviewText: My daughter was the first to watch this and she hated it so much that just seeing the start of a Wiggles trailer made her cringe.  But now, years later, I popped it in for my son and he loved it.Singing and dancing is the name of the game here.  The dancing is sometimes clumsy but the steps are easy enough for young kids to follow along.  Some of the singing is atrocious.  But this is not aimed at me.  The songs are short, fun, and infuriatingly catchy.  I keep singing them at home!I have watched it several times through and even got my daughter to reconsider (even though she is a bigger fan of Andre Rieu, The Royal Ballet, and Angelina Ballerina).I have to say that while the studio performances could be better, the end segment from their live stage show exhibits greater talent (shouldn't it be the other way around).My personal favorite on the show is Dorothy the Dinosaur (she is also the best dancer) and I do find Jeff to be rather odd looking (sometimes creepy).  But all in all, the show captivates my children and the music is catchy.  What more could a parent want?
Title: N/A

reviewText: To my two-year-old, these four guys are the Australian Fab Four!  Their voices are very pleasant, and the songs and dance numbers are catchy too.  They seem to really enjoy what they're doing and have lots of energy (just judging by the end concert portion).  The additional characters (Dorothy, Wags, Henry, and my personal favorite, Captain Feathersword) add to the amusement, as usual.  After a while, you might just be quack-quacking and cockadoodle-doodling right along with them.  It's a definite must for your Wiggles fan!
Title: N/A

reviewText: My 3-year-old is developing an Australian accent through his repeated viewings of this tape!  I have to admit, it's amusing to hear him yell "Wake up Jiff!" at the TV screen and sing along to a song about "Uncle Nao-wah's Auk".The tape is great fun for preschoolers, and it won't drive parents crazy.  No boring plots, no big morality lessons -- just one silly song after another.  You might initially be taken aback at the sight of four grown men hopping and dancing around in unison, but ultimately you will be won over by the high energy and good humour of the songs themselves.
summary: Aussie, Aussie, Aussie!  Oi!  Oi!  Oi!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, my 2-year old daughter loves this video, and I like it too, BUT... the camera changes the scene or the angle every 3 seconds! Yes, I timed it, after watching the 1st song and my eyes started to hurt. If your child has problem with their eyes, I wouldn't buy this. Every 3 seconds changing the scene is just ridiculous. The only time that doesn't happen is in between the songs, when the characters are talking. The songs are catchy, very cute, very interesting!
summary: entertaining, but tough on the eyes!

reviewText: My 4 year old and 13-month old sons love this video.  The songs and dances are upbeat and easy to follow.  And though my 13 month old has a limited vocabulary, the message he sends is always clear when he makes a beeline for the TV after I ask if he wants to "wiggle" or if we start to sing one of the songs.This is my first exposure to the Wiggles...  It's great, it's fun, the kids love it, and it's tolerable to my husband who typically doesn't like any of the kids' songs.  What more could you ask?  Well worth the purchase.
summary: Even my 13 month old is hooked!

reviewText: After much pleading and prodding by my five-year-old son, I finally gave in and bought him "The Wiggles - Wiggle Time."At first, I thought, "Oh no, another glibly tuneful romp through cartoonish juvenilia." But how wrong I was!"The Wiggles" just may represent the only active, truly original modern art form practised by today's desiccated, so-called "artists". When one compares the underlying harmonic and polyphonic structure of a representative tune such as "hot potato dance," one realizes that such complexity and daring have never been heard since Strauss shocked even the jaded Parisians with "Salome"!This is to take nothing away from the dance, however, which rivals anything ever choreographed by Balanchine. The dancers, eschewing the ambits of classical forms and steps, create their own pleitropic vocabulary of movements which bewilder the viewer with their genetic pregnancy.Were this all that the "Wiggles" offered, one could easily imagine that their lack of immediate recognition for the geniuses that they are was due to the subtleties of their art and the jealousies of less talented peers. But only after viewing the disk repeatedly and incessantly (I had to purchase a second copy for myself) did I realize the entirety and awful enormity of the "Wiggles" experience. Such was my shock of insensing comprehension that I felt the universe close around me into a point of awareness centered on one sublime, beautiful, yet terrible truth. I struggled mightily to force order into the epiphany which the "Wiggles" graced upon me. But I could not.Therefore, gentle reader, take heart from my woe. No measure of wisdom or beauty should cost a man his soul.
Title: N/A
